About Me

  • Published 22 Oct 2015
  • Category meta
  • Previous
  • Next

Hello!

I am a twenty something guy who works in tech, and likes discussing pop culture. This is my personal website, named after a relatively obscure Beat Happening song.

What I Do

I work as a QA/Developer-in-test at OpenCredo, an open-source software consultancy, and you can read a more professional work profile over here. If I was really pressed to describe what I do (say, on a quiz show, with Alexander Armstrong hoping I say something interesting), I would probably just say software developer, but that would lose the nuance that I specialise in testing. If you're interested in hiring me, LinkedIn is the place to go.

Interests

In my spare time, I try to avoid being a hipster, but I'm generally not too successful. Here are some varied interests:

  • Quizzes
  • Indiepop music
  • Videogames
  • Independent cinema
  • Geocaching
  • Existentialist woe
  • Puns
  • Liberal politics / economics
  • Statistics

Places you can find me

There are also some places on the internet you can find me that I don't mind sharing.

  • This blog
  • Twitter
  • Github
  • Stack Overflow
  • LinkedIn
  • Last.fm

What I've worked on

Here are some things I've contributed towards.

  • Hearthwiz - A personal project, a Hearthstone webapp written in Rails.
  • ITV Player - Functional testing, performance testing, manual testing.
  • Sedex Advance - Functional testing.
  • useMango - Lead tester (sometimes: the only tester).
  • Top secret government stuff - I'm not supposed to talk about this.

Thanks

Oh yeah, thanks for reading!
